channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: You could win $1.6 billion with the right Powerball ticket, officials say
item.description: The Powerball jackpot now stands at an estimated $1.6 billion, making it one of the largest lottery prizes in U.S. history, Powerball officials said S...

item.title: Trump Halts Five Wind Farms Off the East Coast
item.description: The Interior Department said the projects posed national security risks, without providing details. The decision imperils billions of dollars of inves...

item.title: Evita Duffy-Alonso, daughter of transportation secretary, accuses TSA of ‘absurdly invasive’ pat-down
item.description: “All this for an unconstitutional agency that isn’t even good at its job,” she said, adding that she nearly missed her flight.

item.title: She Fell in Love With ChatGPT. Then She Ghosted It.
item.description: The 29-year-old woman who created the “MyBoyfriendIsAI” community on Reddit isn’t dating (or sexting) her A.I. boyfriend anymore. She found something ...

item.title: A Conspicuous Gap May Undermine Trump’s Birthright Citizenship Plan
item.description: A historical review shows lawmakers without certain familial records went unchallenged as citizens when the 14th Amendment was adopted. The finding ap...

item.title: Jerry Kasenetz, a King of Bubblegum Pop Music, Dies at 82
item.description: With his producing partner, Jeffry Katz, he made lightweight ditties like “Yummy Yummy Yummy” that soared up the charts in the late 1960s.

item.title: Bank of America’s Moynihan says AI’s economic benefit is ‘kicking in more’
item.description: Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan said AI is starting to have a bigger impact on the U.S. economy.

item.title: Trump team triples bonus to $3,000 for migrants who self-deport
item.description: The $3,000 stipend is triple the $1,000 payout the department unveiled in May.

item.title: ‘That really stuck’: Here’s how a 1970s campaign to sell Kentucky Fried Chicken with a bottle of wine became a Japanese Christmas tradition
item.description: "Still today, you have to order your KFC months in advance to make sure that you’re going to get it at Christmas Day.”

item.title: Mistrial in Case of N.Y. Official Charged With Working for China
item.description: Linda Sun was accused by federal prosecutors of selling her allegiance and being rewarded handsomely for influence peddling.

item.title: Carney Names Financier Mark Wiseman as Canada’s U.S. Ambassador
item.description: Mark Wiseman has held high-profile roles in law, business consulting and finance, and will lead Canada’s efforts to reboot diplomatic relation with Wa...

item.title: More Abducted Nigerian Children Are Released, Government Says
item.description: A spokesman for the Nigerian government said the “remaining” students taken from a Catholic school had been freed, but the local diocese said that onl...

item.title: Assad, Ousted Syrian Ruler, Leads Life of Luxury in Russia
item.description: Bashar al-Assad’s long, brutal reign ended swiftly, but he and his close circle have had a soft landing in Russia.

item.title: U.K. Man and 5 Others Charged With Sexual Offenses Against His Wife
item.description: Philip Young, 49, is accused of drugging and raping the woman over a 13-year period. Five other men have been charged in the same case.

item.title: Russian General Is Killed in Car Bombing in Moscow
item.description: The attack appeared to be the latest targeted assassination of a senior military official inside Russia’s borders.
